title: 108_s371
content: Subtitle 3 of Title XXI of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include a section on the adequate supply of vaccines, specifically addressing the supply of vaccines. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating a supply of vaccines for children and adults, including all vaccines recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating a supply of vaccines for adults as recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. The plan must be submitted within one year of the enactment of this section. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating a supply of vaccines for adults as recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. The plan shall be submitted to specific Senate and House committees and include discussions on the basis and prioritization of vaccine purchases. The Secretary must fully implement the plan by September 30, 2006. The Secretary shall require manufacturers to provide at least 1 year notice of vaccine discontinuance. The notification period may be reduced with good cause certification. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be received by the Secretary. The Secretary can use proceeds from vaccine sales to purchase additional vaccines for the supply. Ongoing reports detailing progress and any impediments in implementing the plan must be submitted periodically. The Secretary will also make recommendations in the reports. The Secretary can recommend extending the vaccine supply beyond 6 months and provide a discussion on the reasons for the recommendation. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2004 through 2009.
